Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it in its water habitat.
The student can include details like plants and animals that live with the fish in the water.
The student can identify and label the resources in the fish's habitat, such as water and plants.
The student can show and label how the fish interacts with its habitat (e.g., fish swim in water).
The student can illustrate and label the different parts of the habitat that help the fish survive.
The student can use the drawing to explain how the fish and its habitat are part of a system working together.
